page.title: 03GUITING POWER.OUR PUBS
page.content:
One of our two village pubs is called the Farmer's Arms,and it is run by Donnington Ales. They sell about 7 barrels of beer a week, that is 126 gallons. They sell 200 different sorts of drinks including a Henry which is a mix of orange juice and lemonade, and a Clementine which is a mix of orange and bitter lemon. They have games such as darts, skittles,quoits, snooker,dominoes and cards. They do well with customers because they have about 100 people per day.
The other pub in the village is "Ye Old Inne" and it serves many people with good food and drink, just like the "Farmer's Arms". The pub in Naunton is called "The Black Horse", and the fourth pub in the area is "The Foxhill Inn".
